meta.title: The Cuban Missile Crisis: Digital Museums
meta.subtitle: Story of the river and its gorge
meta.author: Jorja Darrington
meta.description: Accessing information through museum websites from opposing sides of the Cuban Missile Crisis.

imagebackground.title: The Cuban Missile Crisis: Digital Museums
imagebackground.subtitle: Accessing information through museum websites from opposing sides of the Cuban Missile Crisis.
imagebackground.text: When we do research about historical events, how do we acquire information specific to one country's experience? What accessible resources do we as researchers look to when we attempt to understand a nation's perspective? What barriers do we encounter, and why are those barriers in place?

textcentred.title: How do we shape our contextual understanding?
textcentred.subtitle: To understand why researchers encounter barriers whilst researching an event such as the Cuban Missile Crisis, the context must be understood. The following TedX Talk video briefly describes the context of the event.

textcentred.title: The American Perspective
textcentred.subtitle: How does an American Museum portray the Cuban Missile Crisis?
textcentred.intro: Upon searching "Cuban Missile Crisis American Museums", a variety of options populated. The third museum was selected as it is the John F. Kennedy (JFK) Museum, as upon exploration it displayed the event of JFK's presidency.Â

snippets.title: Screenshot of American museum search results.
snippets.alt: Screenshot of American museum search results.

images.title: Screenshots of the virtual Cuban Missile Crisis exhibit.

textcentred.title: The Russian Perspective
textcentred.subtitle: How does a Russian Museum website portray the Cuban Missile Crisis?
textcentred.intro: When searching for a Russian museum with an exhibit on the Cuban Missile Crisis online, the only results that populate are North American websites. When the search is broadened to a Cold War Museum, eventually the Bunker-42 museum website populates.

snippets.title: Search results for a Russian museum.
snippets.alt: Search results for a Russian museum

textcentred.nav_title: Centred Text: Details of the B-42 Museum
textcentred.title: The B-42 Museum
textcentred.intro:
The Bunker 42 Museum has seven tabs within the webpage: history, tours, prices, a photo gallery, patriotic education program information, social support from their sponsors, and contact information. 


The history page explains the construction of the bunker itself rather than the purpose and need for the bunker.

textcentred.title: Why do the two countries differ in their distribution of digital information?
textcentred.intro: As we conduct research on the internet and encounter barriers such as the inability to find up to date, relevant information about nations such as Russia we must think critically about the social, economic, and political dynamics of the internet.

nav.title: Centred Text: Details of the B-42 Museum
